commands.name: az providerhub custom-rollout create
commands.syntax:
az providerhub custom-rollout create --name
                                     --provider-namespace
                                     [--auto-provision-config]
                                     [--canary]
                                     [--manifest-checkin-spec]
                                     [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--provider-registration]
                                     [--refresh-sub-reg {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--release-scopes]
                                     [--resource-type-registrations]
                                     [--skip-release-scope-validation {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--status]
examples: az providerhub custom-rollout create --provider-namespace "{providerNamespace}" --rollout-name "{customRolloutName}" --canary region="EastUS2EUAP" region="centraluseuap"

commands.name: az providerhub custom-rollout delete
commands.summary: Delete the custom rollout resource. Custom rollout must be in terminal state.

commands.name: az providerhub custom-rollout list
commands.summary: List the list of the custom rollouts for the given provider.

commands.name: az providerhub custom-rollout stop
commands.summary: Stops or cancels the custom rollout, if in progress.

commands.name: az providerhub custom-rollout update
commands.syntax:
az providerhub custom-rollout update [--add]
                                     [--auto-provision-config]
                                     [--canary]
                                     [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--ids]
                                     [--manifest-checkin-spec]
                                     [--name]
                                     [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--provider-namespace]
                                     [--provider-registration]
                                     [--refresh-sub-reg {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--release-scopes]
                                     [--remove]
                                     [--resource-type-registrations]
                                     [--set]
                                     [--skip-release-scope-validation {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--status]
                                     [--subscription]
examples: az providerhub custom-rollout update --provider-namespace "{providerNamespace}" --rollout-name "{customRolloutName}" --canary region="EastUS2EUAP" region="centraluseuap"

commands.name: az providerhub custom-rollout wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
